documents.title: good evening from coventry and warwickshire
text: we 're back at 08:00 on thursday with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates through the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: through this evening and overnight , showers will ease through to leave a dry night , with some clear spells developing , but with a chance of some isolated fog patches , particularly towards the avon valley .
it will stay mild overnight with light winds .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .

documents.title: coming up on bbc midlands today this evening
text: they have come in their thousands today with paintings , porcelain and parcels to see the bbc antiques roadshow experts in warwickshire .
our reporter sarah falkland has spent the day in baddesley clinton .
join me for bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: wasps say they will push ahead with plans to redevelop home of coventry city academy - despite club 's plea
text: wasps have confirmed they will press ahead with plans to redevelop the home of coventry city 's academy , despite a request from the football club to withdraw the proposals .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: fiona bruce 'loves job '
text: i 've been speaking to presenter fiona bruce as hundreds of people have turned up at baddesley clinton , near lapworth , for the filming of the bbc antiques roadshow .
the presenter has loved every minute on the programme .
she told me : `` when it 's bucketing down it 's slightly less dreamy , but yes i love this job , i 've been doing it for nine years now and i count myself lucky every time . ''
author: Vic Minett
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: ukulele festival expected to bring thousands to warwick racecourse
text: ukulele players from across the uk are set to descend on warwick racecourse as it plays host to a vibrant festival of music .
author: Leamington Spa Courier

documents.title: better in or out ? a referendum special on bbc one
text: leading figures from the leave and remain campaigns in the west midlands debate the issues around the eu referendum in front of a studio audience .
join us this sunday from 22:35 on bbc one .

Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: when the magic of muhammed ali filled nuneaton football ground
text: former nuneaton borough chairman noel kelly will never forget the `` magical day '' he spent with muhammad ali .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: shakespeare 's will comes 'home '
text: william shakespeare 's last will and testament will return to stratford-upon-avon for the first time since it was written 400 years ago .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: sky blues in plea to wasps owners
text: coventry city fc is calling on the owners of wasps rugby club to abandon plans to use the alan higgs centre for training because it could put the future of the sky blues academy in jeopardy .
at the moment the football club uses the centre as a base to train young players .
sky blues vice chairman chris anderson said it needed more time to work on a plan for the academy .

`` at a minimum we would ask them to hit the pause button and maybe the reset button and i think sit down with us and sit down with the operator of the facility , coventry sports foundation , to see if together we can chart the future for league football , youth football , in coventry . ''
wasps said it wanted to create its own training facilities at the site and had said in the past the sky blues could use them .
author: Philip Churm
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry city would welcome newcastle united starlet adam armstrong back 'with open arms '
text: coventry city would welcome back newcastle united 's adam amstrong with open arms if he was available next season .
and technical director mark venus admits the sky blues would be mad not to try to re-sign the teenager , who netted 20 goals in league one last term .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: illegal immigrants flee bedworth car wash during police sting
text: illegal immigrants fled a bedworth car wash when they spotted police about to swoop in .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: continue registering to vote in eu referendum , david cameron says
text: david cameron has urged people to continue to register to vote after an online glitch ahead of the eu referendum registration deadline .
the prime minister tweeted a link to the sign-up page and said `` urgent discussions '' were taking place to ensure people who register can vote .
the electoral commission called for the registration deadline to be extended .
the problems lasted from 22:15 bst on tuesday until after the midnight deadline .
follow live updates on the eu referendum .
if you are n't registered & you want to vote in this eu referendum you should continue to register at
any chance of extending vote to 16yr olds .
they have more to lose from # brexit than 60 year olds ?
if we remain they 'll add to the already sky high youth unemployment in the eu , all to gain nothing to lose .
how is uk 's 4.9 % unemployment going to improve if eu stops buying uk goods & services ?
trade will still be there markets dictate this and not politicians
leaving the free trade area will dictate the loss in uk sales .
the risk to the german economy & german jobs should they suddenly say , hey , we 're not trading with uk is greater
you think we will stop buying french wine , german cars ?
our biggest export is services .
killed with a stroke .
of course we will still buy , and they will still a trade so as you know you 've answered your own question .
are you trying to cheat ?
the deadline for registering was yesterday .
surely more democratic to allow people to register to vote ?
do n't you hate the undemocracy of the eu ? ?
# hypocrite # idiot
`` interested in respectful discussion '' , my ass .
go fling your insults elsewhere .
no do n't block me .
please .
i 'm so interested .
please .
he 's pm and with mps support he can .
actually yes there is a power to amend the date in the act itself by statutory instrument
so why do you contest the legality ?
the change can and will have retroactive effect
you 're a funny one !
they have the legal power , and the change is retroactive .
end of
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: concern over open land near jaguar land rover site
text: there is concern open land near coventry 's jaguar land rover whitley site could be re-designated for building .
people living near baginton fields want the site preserved and more consultation over its future .
mark andrews , from the city council , said it would do whatever it could to secure jobs and investment .
he said : `` we totally understand what the concerns of the local community are .
we 're more than happy to continue that discussion and that conversation as the plan emerges . ''
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: 'reckless ' claverdon pensioner caused man 's death
text: the family of a man who died in a road traffic collision last year have described the actions of the claverdon pensioner who caused his death as reckless and indefensible '' .
author: Leamington Spa Courier

documents.title: weather watcher blue sky over southam
text: this of southam , in warwickshire , has been uploaded today by bbc weather watcher old salt .
they 're volunteers who keep us updated with the forecast in their area and you can become one too by joining up on the website .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: midlands today
text: hundreds of people have taken their treasures to warwickshire today for bbc antiques roadshow at baddesley clinton .
our reporter sarah falkland is there for us this lunchtime .
join me at 13:30 for bbc midlands today on bbc one .
author: Nicola Beckford
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: new figures reveal coventry children as young as eight are caught with knives in school
text: an eight-year-old child was caught with a blade in a coventry school , according to police stats revealed to the telegraph .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: man suffers serious burns in fire
text: a fire at a commercial building near to honeybourne airfield has left a 55-year-old man with serious burns .
the man , who had suffered burns to his face , head and arms , was taken by ambulance to queen elizabeth hospital birmingham .
west midlands ambulance service said it received a call from the fire service at 09:30 to reports of an explosion near to the airfield .

documents.title: news : fire at industrial estate ; concern over open land ; hundreds at antiques roadshow recording
text: today 's headlines include :
- a man is being treated for severe burns at a fire at an industrial estate near evesham
- there is concern open land near coventry 's jaguar land rover whitley site could be re-designated for building
- hundreds of people have turned up at baddesley clinton , near lapworth , for the filming of the bbc antiques roadshow
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: man treated for severe burns at fire
text: a man is being treated for severe burns at a fire at the honeybourne industrial estate near evesham .
fire crews and west midlands ambulance service are at the scene after getting the call at about 09:30 to reports of an explosion near to honeybourne airfield .
people are being warned to keep away from the area as a number of gas tanks are next to where the fire is .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: warning of heavy rain
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for heavy , thundery showers this afternoon and evening across the west midlands .
while most will avoid the showers , there is the potential for a few isolated heavy , thundery bursts that could lead to tricky driving conditions and localised flooding .
a yellow severe weather warning for # rain has been issued : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: charlie slater looks ahead to what 's in store for us over the next 24-hours .

documents.title: roads flood after heavy rain
text: thunderstorms hit parts of the region last night , bringing down trees and causing travel disruption .
drivers are being warned to take extra care following flash flooding on roads in worcestershire and warwickshire
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: travel : crash on a4082 in coventry
text: the a4082 allard way in coventry is partially blocked eastbound at the b4110 humber road junction because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cricket : warwickshire beat leicestershire
text: warwickshire beat leicestershire at edgbaston in emphatic style in the royal london one day cup .
sam hain hit an unbeaten 105 off 124 balls to help them to a nine wicket win .
it was his first century in that form of the game at this level .
the bears are back in one day cup action later as they take on notts at trent bridge and you can hear ball-by-ball coverage online .
in case you missed it , read @ twitterid report of last night 's @ twitterid win # youbears

documents.title: campaigners say free school fight not over
text: campaigners against plans to open a new free secondary school in rugby say they 'll keep fighting to get it stopped .
the department for education has agreed it can open on the site of rokeby primary in anderson avenue from september .
the group against it has told bbc coventry and warwickshire they want a meeting with the academy trust behind the scheme .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: 75-year-old hit by car in nuneaton
text: a 75-year-old woman has been taken to hospital after being hit by a car in nuneaton .
warwickshire police say the collision happened yesterday morning on church street .
the force says the 92-year-old driver of the car involved was n't hurt .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: late freight train causing delays
text: a late running freight train at warwick parkway is causing delays of up to 30 minutes between leamington spa and birmingham / stratford-upon-avon , network rail reports .
this is expected to continue until approximately 10:00 .

documents.title: antiques roadshow recording at baddesley today
text: hundreds of people are expected to turn out today for the filming of the bbc antiques roadshow at baddesley clinton in warwickshire .
leading antiques and fine arts experts will be on hand to offer free advice and valuations .
visitors are invited to bring along family heirlooms , household treasures and car-boot sale bargains for inspection .
an # antiquesroadshow taster on @ twitterid with marc allum & daniel ahead of tomorrow 's show .
@ twitterid
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: news : sun protection concerns ; free school fight ; 75-year-old hit by car
text: this morning 's headlines for coventry and warwickshire include
- there are concerns children in coventry and warwickshire might not be properly protected from the sun as no schools are signed up to a scheme that teaches them about the dangers
- campaigners against plans to open a new free secondary school in rugby say they 'll keep fighting to get it stopped
- a 75-year-old woman has been taken to hospital after being hit by a car in nuneaton
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: cricket : warwickshire thrash leicestershire by nine wickets
text: opener sam hain 's maiden limited-overs century helped warwickshire secure a nine-wicket victory over leicestershire in the one-day cup at edgbaston .
hong kong-born hain , 20 , made 105 not out in only his third list a domestic match and put on 169 for the first wicket with william porterfield ( 75 ) .
earlier , kevin o'brien made 77 but leicestershire slipped from 129-2 to 134-6 as jeetan patel took 3-46 .
rob taylor 's 66-ball 62 helped push the visitors to 237 all out .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : slow going on a45 near coventry
text: there 's queuing traffic on the a45 london road inbound in ryton-on-dunsmore between the a423 junction and the tollbar island .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : warm and sunny day
text: it 'll be a mostly fine , warm day with plenty of sunshine .
some showers , perhaps heavy , may develop in places during the afternoon , although most should remain dry with highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: welcome to our live service for wednesday 8 june .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates between now and 18:00 .
you can get in touch with us via email or tweet us @ bbccovwarks .
